section.title: RPC Commands
section.para: The state of the global flags can be read and modified over the RPC interface. This module implements the following RPC interface commands:

section.title: gflags.set
section.para: gflags.set - Set the value of a flag to 1. The function accepts one parameter which is the number of the flag to be set.

section.title: gflags.reset
section.para: gflags.reset - Reset the value of a flag to 0. The function accepts one parameter which is the number of the flag to be reset.

section.title: gflags.is_set
section.para: gflags.is_set - Return the status of a flag. The FIFO function would return TRUE if the flag is set and FALSE if it is not set. The only parameter of this function is the number of the flag.

section.title: gflags.flush
section.para: gflags.flush - Flush the state of global flags into database.

section.title: gflags.dump
section.para: gflags.dump - Return the status of all flags. The value is TRUE if the flag is set and FALSE if the flag is not set. The function has no parameters.

section.title: global.reload
section.para: global.reload - Reload values from global_attrs DB table. This function does not have any parameters. There is no return value on success.
